#include<bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

void gdown();
void uprt();
void dnlt();
void sexy();// set x and y
void write(int);
int check();
int box[100][100];
int a,b,n,no,p,q;

int main(){
	int i,j,exit;
	
	n=3; no=15;
	a=0; b=(n-1)/2;//cout<<b<<endl;
	
	box[a][b]=no;
	
	while(no<25)
	{
		no++;
		uprt();
		while(box[a][b]!='\0')
		{
		 a=p;
		 b=q;
		 gdown();
		}
		write(no);
	}
	
		for(i=0;i<n;i++)
		{
			for(j=0;j<n;j++)
			printf(" ",box[i][j]);
			printf("\n");
		}
	
	
	
	return 0;
}

void gdown(){//cout<<"---->>down\n";
a+=1;sexy();//cout<<"a="<<a<<"b="<<b<<"\n";
}
void uprt(){
//cout<<"enter--up right\n";
a-=1;b+=1;sexy();
//cout<<"a="<<a<<"b="<<b<<"\n";
}
void dnlt(){
//cout<<"enter--downleft\n";
a+=1;b-=1;sexy();
//cout<<"a="<<a<<"b="<<b<<"\n";
}

/* Travelling in the matrix for perfect co-ordinates
   This will take care of boundaries*/
void sexy(){
//a-no	b-yes
//cout<<"n-1="<<n<<endl;
if(a<0 && b<n)
	{a=n-1;//cout<<"n-1="<<n-1<<endl;
	//cout<<"reached a-no b-yes : a="<<a<<endl;
		}
//a-yes	b-no	
else if(a>=0 &&  b>=n)
		{
		b=0;
		//cout<<"reached a-yes b-no : b="<<b<<endl;	
		}
//a-no b-no
else if(a<0 &&  b>=n)
		{
		a=n-1;
		b=0;
		//cout<<"reached BOTH : a="<<a<<"b="<<b<<endl;
		}
}

void write(int no){
	p=a;
    q=b;
	//cout<<"a="<<a<<"b="<<b<<" in write fn "<<endl;
	box[a][b]=no;
	//cout<<"wrote "<<no<<endl;/
}
